result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren Cowart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $1000 including costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $75 per month commencing 7-1-14 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darren Cowart

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darren Cowart in court with attorney Munjed A Ahmad.  Karen A Loebel for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 3 days at the House of Correction with 3 days credit; pay a fine of $1,000 including costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $75 per month commencing 7-1-14 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.

Defendant Darren Cowart in court with attorney Munjed A Ahmad.  Nathaniel E Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  On motion of the State, Court AMENDS the charge to Possession of Tetrahydracannabols 961.41(3g)(e) an unclassified misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darren Cowart in court with attorney Munjed A Ahmad.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense has received a new offer and would like time to review.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darren Cowart in court with attorney Jeffrey J. Guerard.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darren Cowart in court with attorney Jeffrey J. Guerard.  Dennis Murphy, appearing for William Levins, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  
Arraignment was NOT held.

Co-defendant is scheduled in Branch 44 on 03-18-2014;  Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment and Scheduling Conference in Branch 44.
Clerk:  jms
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances (NO ILLEGAL DRUGS).

Defendant Darren Cowart in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 01-06-2014
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-5-2014 at 1:00pm
